definition:
The weight lattice $\Lambda_W$ of a root system $R\subset E$ is the
lattice
$$\Lambda_W=\left\{ e\in E \left| \frac{(e,\alpha)}{(\alpha,\alpha)}\in\mathbb{Z} \text{ for all } r\in R \right. \right\} .$$
Weights which lie in the weight lattice are called [**]{}. If
$R\subset\mathfrak{h}$ is the root system of a semi-simple Lie algebra
$\mathfrak{g}$ with Cartan subalgebra $\mathfrak{h}$, then $\Lambda_W$
is exactly the set of weights appearing in finite dimensional
representations of $\mathfrak{g}$.
